thread.title: Overworked Angels bullpen melts down in seventh and Texas cruises to victory - OCRegister
thread.title_full: Overworked Angels bullpen melts down in seventh and Texas cruises to victory - OCRegister

title: Overworked Angels bullpen melts down in seventh and Texas cruises to victory - OCRegister
text: Overworked Angels bullpen melts down in seventh and Texas cruises to victory Oct. 4, 2015 Updated 7:08 p.m. 1 of 33 Angels' reliever Mike Morin tries to get out of the way of Adrian Beltre's infield single during the Rangers' six run seventh inning during the Halos' 9-2 loss to the Rangers Sunday at Globe Life Park in Arlington, Texas. KEVIN SULLIVAN , STAFF PHOTOGRAPHER 1 of 33 The Angels' Johnny Giavotella reacts after hitting into a fielders choice to end the top of the seventh inning during Sunday's 9-2 loss to the Rangers at Globe Life Park in Arlington, Texas. KEVIN SULLIVAN, STAFF PHOTOGRAPHER 1 of 33 The Rangers' Josh Hamilton scores past Angels catcher Carlos Perez to cap a six-run seventh inning during the Angels' 9-2 loss Sunday. KEVIN SULLIVAN, STAFF PHOTOGRAPHER 1 of 33 The Angels' Erick Aybar frowns after striking out looking in the eighth inning during Sunday's 9-2 loss to the Rangers at Globe Life Park in Arlington, Texas. , KEVIN SULLIVAN, STAFF PHOTOGRAPHER 1 of 33 Rangers fans celebrate as the Angels' Mike Trout grounds out to end the top of the eighth inning. KEVIN SULLIVAN, STAFF PHOTOGRAPHER 1 of 33 Former Angels Mike Napoli and Josh Hamilton celebrate behind Angels catcher Carlos Perez during a six-run seventh inning for Texas. KEVIN SULLIVAN, STAFF PHOTOGRAPHER 1 of 33 The Angels' Mike Trout walks back to the dugout after taking a knee to the head from the Rangers' Rougned Odor trying to break up a double play in the sixth inning. KEVIN SULLIVAN, STAFF PHOTOGRAPHER 1 of 33 The Angels' David Freese ends up on the ground after failing to make a play on a Delino DeShields infield single during the Rangers' six-run seventh inning. KEVIN SULLIVAN, STAFF PHOTOGRAPHER 1 of 33 Angels' starter Garrett Richards slumps on the mound as the Rangers' Adrian Beltre rounds the bases after his two-run home run in the fifth inning of the Halos' 9-2 loss to the Rangers Sunday at Globe Life Park in Arlington, Texas. KEVIN SULLIVAN , STAFF PHOTOGRAPHER 1 of 33 Angels' starter Garrett Richards sits in the dugout after giving up two walks and an RBI single in the first inning during the Halos' 9-2 loss to the Rangers Sunday at Globe Life Park in Arlington, Texas. KEVIN SULLIVAN , STAFF PHOTOGRAPHER 1 of 33 Rangers' starter Cole Hamels pitched a complete game three-hitter against the Angels giving up two runs on three hits during the Rangers' 9-2 victory over the Halos Sunday at Globe Life Park in Arlington, Texas. KEVIN SULLIVAN , STAFF PHOTOGRAPHER 1 of 33 The Angels' /Albert Pujols rounds the bases after his two run home run in the first inning off of Rangers' starter Cole Hamels during the Halos' 9-2 loss to the Rangers Sunday at Globe Life Park in Arlington, Texas. KEVIN SULLIVAN , STAFF PHOTOGRAPHER 1 of 33 An unhappy Angel fan watches the game after Adrian Beltre's go-ahead, two-run home run in the fifth inning during the Halos' 9-2 loss to the Rangers Sunday at Globe Life Park in Arlington, Texas. KEVIN SULLIVAN , STAFF PHOTOGRAPHER 1 of 33 The Rangers' Adrian Beltre rounds the bases after his two-run home run in the fifth inning off of Angels' starter Garrett Richards during the Halos' 9-2 loss to the Rangers Sunday at Globe Life Park in Arlington, Texas. KEVIN SULLIVAN , STAFF PHOTOGRAPHER 1 of 33 The Angels' C.J. Cron exhales after flying out to end the top of the sixth inning during the Halos' 9-2 loss to the Rangers Sunday at Globe Life Park in Arlington, Texas. KEVIN SULLIVAN , STAFF PHOTOGRAPHER 1 of 33 Mike Trout watches the final outs of the Angels' season from the dugout rail during the team's 9-2 loss to the Rangers Sunday at Globe Life Park in Arlington, Texas. , KEVIN SULLIVAN, STAFF PHOTOGRAPHER 1 of 33 Angels' reliever Mike Morin heads to cover home on Elvis Andrus' double during the Rangers' six run seventh inning of the Halos' 9-2 loss to the Rangers Sunday at Globe Life Park in Arlington, Texas. KEVIN SULLIVAN , STAFF PHOTOGRAPHER 1 of 33 Angels' relievers Cam Bedrosian, left, and Mike Morin sit in the dugout after the Rangers' six run seventh inning during the Halos' 9-2 loss to the Texas Rangers Sunday at Globe Life Park in Arlington, Texas. KEVIN SULLIVAN , STAFF PHOTOGRAPHER 1 of 33 The Angels' Shane Victorino leaves the dugout after the Halos' 9-2 loss to the Rangers Sunday at Globe Life Park in Arlington, Texas. KEVIN SULLIVAN , STAFF PHOTOGRAPHER 1 of 33 The Angels' Daniel Robertson watches the Rangers' celebration after the Halos' 9-2 loss to the Rangers Sunday at Globe Life Park in Arlington, Texas. KEVIN SULLIVAN , STAFF PHOTOGRAPHER 1 of 33 The Angels' Albert Pujols hits a two run home run in the first inning off of Rangers' starter Cole Hamels during the Halos' 9-2 loss to the Rangers Sunday at Globe Life Park in Arlington, Texas. KEVIN SULLIVAN , STAFF PHOTOGRAPHER 1 of 33 The Rangers' Hanser Alberto runs past Cole Hamels after the Angels' David Freese, left, grounded out to end the game during the Halos' 9-2 loss to the Rangers Sunday at Globe Life Park in Arlington, Texas. KEVIN SULLIVAN , STAFF PHOTOGRAPHER 1 of 33 The Rangers' Josh Hamilton is lifted up by catcher Chris Gimenez as he celebrates with teammates after the Rangers' eliminated the Angels' with their 9-2 victory Sunday at Globe Life Park in Arlington, Texas. KEVIN SULLIVAN , STAFF PHOTOGRAPHER 1 of 33 The Angels' Albert Pujols look out from the dugout during the Halos' 9-2 loss to the Rangers Sunday at Globe Life Park in Arlington, Texas. KEVIN SULLIVAN , STAFF PHOTOGRAPHER 1 of 33 Angels' starter Garrett Richards reacts on the mound as the Rangers' Adrian Beltre rounds the bases after his two-run home run in the fifth inning of the Halos' 9-2 loss to the Rangers Sunday at Globe Life Park in Arlington, Texas. KEVIN SULLIVAN , STAFF PHOTOGRAPHER 1 of 33 The Rangers' Rougned Odor throws the ball away attempting a double play as the Angels' Mike Trout slides into second the Halos' 9-2 loss to the Rangers Sunday at Globe Life Park in Arlington, Texas. KEVIN SULLIVAN , STAFF PHOTOGRAPHER 1 of 33 The Angels' Albert Pujols is greeted in the dugout after his two run home run in the first inning off of Rangers' starter Cole Hamels during the Halos' 9-2 loss to the Rangers Sunday at Globe Life Park in Arlington, Texas. KEVIN SULLIVAN , STAFF PHOTOGRAPHER 1 of 33 The Rangers' Delino DeShields scores past Angels' catcher Carlos Perez during Texas' six run seventh inning during the Halos' 9-2 loss to the Rangers Sunday at Globe Life Park in Arlington, Texas. KEVIN SULLIVAN , STAFF PHOTOGRAPHER 1 of 33 The Angels' Daniel Robertson watches the Rangers' celebration after the Halos' 9-2 loss to the Rangers Sunday at Globe Life Park in Arlington, Texas. KEVIN SULLIVAN , STAFF PHOTOGRAPHER 1 of 33 Angels' starter Garrett Richards gave up three runs on six hits in six innings of work during the Halos' 9-2 loss to the Rangers Sunday at Globe Life Park in Arlington, Texas. KEVIN SULLIVAN , STAFF PHOTOGRAPHER 1 of 33 Angels' reliever Cesar Ramos walks off the field after walking in a run during the Halos' 9-2 loss to the Rangers Sunday at Globe Life Park in Arlington, Texas. KEVIN SULLIVAN , STAFF PHOTOGRAPHER 1 of 33 The Angels' Albert Pujols blows a bubble in the dugout as the Halos' season comes to an end during the Halos' 9-2 loss to the Rangers Sunday at Globe Life Park in Arlington, Texas. KEVIN SULLIVAN , STAFF PHOTOGRAPHER 1 of 33 View slideshow Angels' reliever Mike Morin tries to get out of the way of Adrian Beltre's infield single during the Rangers' six run seventh inning during the Halos' 9-2 loss to the Rangers Sunday at Globe Life Park in Arlington, Texas. KEVIN SULLIVAN , STAFF PHOTOGRAPHER
